FuncDef:
The rui-option command configures an option code carried in user packets when rui-slave type address pools are applying for an address to a remote DHCP server in a multi-device backup scenario.
undo rui-option command restores the default configuration.
The rui-option dhcpv6 command configures an option code carried in user packets when rui-slave type IPv6 address pools are applying for an address to a remote DHCPv6 server in a multi-device backup scenario.
undo rui-option dhcpv6 command restores the default configuration.
By default, the value of the option code is 151.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the value of the IPv4 option code.
The value is an integer ranging from 151 to 174.

Specifies the value of the IPv6 option code.
The value is an integer ranging from 151 to 174.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In a multi-device backup scenario, the option code needs to be carried in user packets when rui-slave type IPv4 address pools or IPv6 address pools are applying for an address to a remote DHCP server or a remote DHCPv6 server. This command specifies the value of the option code.
The default value of rui-option command is option code 151. If 151 has already been used by the option code command, the default value of this command cannot be used, and the rui-option command needs to be run to change the specified option code.The default value of rui-option dhcpv6 command is option code 151. If 151 has already been used by the option code command, the default value of this command cannot be used, and the rui-option dhcpv6 command needs to be run to change the specified option code.

Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
In a multi-device backup scenario, both master and slave devices that use rui-slave type address pools need to be configured with the same option code, which must be different from that configured in the option code command.In a multi-device backup scenario, both master and slave devices that use rui-slave type IPv6 address pools need to be configured with the same option code, which must be different from that configured in the option code command.
